title: MySQL Functions (User-Defined)
subject: MySQL
theory:
## Custom Functions
Just like built-in functions (`SUM`, `UPPER`), you can create your own **User-Defined Functions (UDFs)**.

### Characteristics
* Must return a single value.
* Can be used in SQL statements (`SELECT`, `WHERE`, etc.).
* Cannot perform transactions or modify tables (usually).

common_mistakes.correction: If bin-logging is on, you must specify `DETERMINISTIC` (or NO SQL) to create functions.

summary: UDFs extend SQL capabilities for simple calculations and formatting logic.
